title: The PIE To DIE For
body_text:
"Reluctantly crouched at the starting line, engines pumping and thumping in time.
The green light flashes, the flags go up. Churning and burning, they yearn for the cup .."
It was only one of the biggest wars ever witnessed as three of
EastCoastDodgeball's
most recognized power couples were divorced into a massive, rare 3-on-3 encounter. And for nearly two years, die-hard fans had waited with great anticipation for the return of the game's most popular ingredient - the dreaded
CREAMation
stipulation - and no doubt were they in for an event impossible to forget.
MATCH SUMMARY
Perhaps never before had seven incredibly-fun, yet ultra-fierce rounds been so closely contested the likes of which experienced on October 16, 2010. The non-stop inaugural bout launched the mayhem to seemingly no end signaling the beginning of both "Divorce Court" and the one-point advantage for the Rafferty-Hoppe-Spengeman combination. The sophomore game duplicated the success of the self-named "Team RAD" only for them to be denied the same conclusive results in the following third and fourth.
By the time battles 5 and 6 rolled around, it was clear the physical and mental toll was off the page as several soldiers became either limited in mobility and/or unfortunately sidelined for good*. More importantly to the match itself, both coalitions traded victories yet again keeping the engagement from termination at an even 3.
The deadly seventh proved to be the deciding opportunity to put all the verbal disputes, debatable calls, and brutality to rest. In the last second of the final hour,
ECDElitest
Diana DiBuccio managed to methodically dismiss fellow
Elitist
and long-time nemesis Justin Pierce from further destruction. Along with her only ally, Captain Dan Spengeman, still alive, she followed up with pivotal kills on Steve Pham and enemy general Mullins. These crucial, wisely-timed eliminations opened up the chance for Captain Spengeman himself to seal the deal with a bullet perpetrated against Hall of Fame-bound female titan, Lauren Stopa.
Ryan Rafferty
,
Ashley Hoppe
, and
Dan Spengeman
defeated
Julia Dennebaum
,
Michael Edwards
, and
Michelle Mullins
, 4 - 3.
Those absent from this magical melee if you will, surely missed one of
ECD's
finest presentations and, more specifically, its heart-pounding ending.
EXCLUSIVE VIDEOS!
Dennebaum
CREAMation
..
Edwards
CREAMation
..
Mullins
CREAMation
*Injured Reserves!
The combination of dodgeball's month-long absence and the chilly October breeze sent several combatants home with various aches and pains. New female sensation
Joanice Lima
and legendary
ECDElitist
Kevin Megill
battled leg and throwing arm injuries, respectively, prior to "Divorce Court" and were held to playing defensively. By Game 2, "The Writer's" right-hand man and first overall selection
John Tronolone
joined the injured reserves switching from his powerful primary throwing stance to an inconsistent southpaw position after his right arm began to quickly give out. The casualties didn't cease there either.
In one of the scarier moments, leading lady
Ashley Hoppe's
viciously contorted left knee kept her seated along the sidelines for the remainder of "Divorce Court."
ECDElitist
Mike "Sputz" Krott's
potential broken toe,
Mari Travassos'
buckled right knee, and Captain
Dan Spengeman's
sore shoulder and arm muscles should have all been obvious clues to throw in the towel earlier than the usual 9pm mark.
Records and Recogntion
Attendance
: 22, comprised of 15 men and 7 women.
New Dodgeballers
: (2) Michael Petschenik and Alec Moran
Game Rules
: Classic two-team.
Featured Match
: Ryan Rafferty, Ashley Hoppe, and Dan Spengeman defeated Julia Dennebaum, Michael Edwards, and Michelle Mullins in
ECD's
10th
CREAMation Rules
contest. This was the first 3-on-3 match contested under
CREAMation Rules
and only the fourth 3-on-3 match ever.
Game-By-Game Results
: Rafferty/Hoppe/Spengeman 1, 2, 5, 7 ; Dennebaum/Edwards/Mullins 3, 4, 6
Captains Records
: Rafferty 1-0-0; Hoppe 2-0-0; Spengeman 5-1-0; Dennebaum 0-1-0; Edwards 5-2-1; Mullins 0-2-1.
Rafferty and Dennebaum became the first two captains to compete in their debut match under the
CREAMation Rules
stipulation.
Edwards became only the third captain in history to compete in two separate 3-on-3 wars following Kevin Fitzpatrick (100, CXV) and Juan Londono (CXV, 150).
Soundtrack
: Julia Dennebaum
Theme Song
: "The Distance" by Cake
Online Exclusive!
Believe it or not, the
CREAMation Rules
stipulation was planned way back in mid-summer without any captains even scheduled. But in August, Julia Dennebaum discussed the possibility of becoming team general with current boyfriend Ryan Rafferty. They immediately agreed on the then-originally planned attraction pitting both she and Ryan against Ashley Hoppe and a reluctant Michael Edwards.
Around the time of
ECD's
"5 Year Anniversary" extravaganza, another couple was added to the mix in veterans Michelle Mullins and Dan Spengeman. With three boyfriend-girlfriend pairs willing and able to compete - none ever partaking in a
CREAMation
bout - each were split into the two formidable factions seen at "Divorce Court."
It should also be noted that a possible fourth duo - Mari Travassos and Jon Yochum - were also asked to participate. Mari's work schedule however conflicted with her definite participation.
________________________________________
___________________
Next Event
: WALL faces ALL for the first time in nearly 24 months on November 27. (Date subject to change)
body_html:
"Reluctantly crouched at the starting line, engines pumping and thumping in time.
The green light flashes, the flags go up. Churning and burning, they yearn for the cup .."


It was only one of the biggest wars ever witnessed as three of EastCoastDodgeball's most recognized power couples were divorced into a massive, rare 3-on-3 encounter. And for nearly two years, die-hard fans had waited with great anticipation for the return of the game's most popular ingredient - the dreaded CREAMation stipulation - and no doubt were they in for an event impossible to forget.

MATCH SUMMARY
Perhaps never before had seven incredibly-fun, yet ultra-fierce rounds been so closely contested the likes of which experienced on October 16, 2010. The non-stop inaugural bout launched the mayhem to seemingly no end signaling the beginning of both "Divorce Court" and the one-point advantage for the Rafferty-Hoppe-Spengeman combination. The sophomore game duplicated the success of the self-named "Team RAD" only for them to be denied the same conclusive results in the following third and fourth.

By the time battles 5 and 6 rolled around, it was clear the physical and mental toll was off the page as several soldiers became either limited in mobility and/or unfortunately sidelined for good*. More importantly to the match itself, both coalitions traded victories yet again keeping the engagement from termination at an even 3.

The deadly seventh proved to be the deciding opportunity to put all the verbal disputes, debatable calls, and brutality to rest. In the last second of the final hour, ECDElitest Diana DiBuccio managed to methodically dismiss fellow Elitist and long-time nemesis Justin Pierce from further destruction. Along with her only ally, Captain Dan Spengeman, still alive, she followed up with pivotal kills on Steve Pham and enemy general Mullins. These crucial, wisely-timed eliminations opened up the chance for Captain Spengeman himself to seal the deal with a bullet perpetrated against Hall of Fame-bound female titan, Lauren Stopa.

Ryan Rafferty, Ashley Hoppe, and Dan Spengeman defeated Julia Dennebaum, Michael Edwards, and Michelle Mullins, 4 - 3.

Those absent from this magical melee if you will, surely missed one of ECD's finest presentations and, more specifically, its heart-pounding ending.

EXCLUSIVE VIDEOS!
Dennebaum CREAMation .. Edwards CREAMation .. Mullins CREAMation

*Injured Reserves!
The combination of dodgeball's month-long absence and the chilly October breeze sent several combatants home with various aches and pains. New female sensation Joanice Lima and legendary ECDElitist Kevin Megill battled leg and throwing arm injuries, respectively, prior to "Divorce Court" and were held to playing defensively. By Game 2, "The Writer's" right-hand man and first overall selection John Tronolone joined the injured reserves switching from his powerful primary throwing stance to an inconsistent southpaw position after his right arm began to quickly give out. The casualties didn't cease there either.

In one of the scarier moments, leading lady Ashley Hoppe's viciously contorted left knee kept her seated along the sidelines for the remainder of "Divorce Court." ECDElitist Mike "Sputz" Krott's potential broken toe, Mari Travassos' buckled right knee, and Captain Dan Spengeman's sore shoulder and arm muscles should have all been obvious clues to throw in the towel earlier than the usual 9pm mark.

Records and Recogntion
Attendance: 22, comprised of 15 men and 7 women.
New Dodgeballers: (2) Michael Petschenik and Alec Moran

Game Rules: Classic two-team.
Featured Match: Ryan Rafferty, Ashley Hoppe, and Dan Spengeman defeated Julia Dennebaum, Michael Edwards, and Michelle Mullins in ECD's 10th CREAMation Rules contest. This was the first 3-on-3 match contested under CREAMation Rules and only the fourth 3-on-3 match ever.
Game-By-Game Results: Rafferty/Hoppe/Spengeman 1, 2, 5, 7 ; Dennebaum/Edwards/Mullins 3, 4, 6
Captains Records: Rafferty 1-0-0; Hoppe 2-0-0; Spengeman 5-1-0; Dennebaum 0-1-0; Edwards 5-2-1; Mullins 0-2-1.
  • Rafferty and Dennebaum became the first two captains to compete in their debut match under the CREAMation Rules stipulation.
  • Edwards became only the third captain in history to compete in two separate 3-on-3 wars following Kevin Fitzpatrick (100, CXV) and Juan Londono (CXV, 150).

    Soundtrack: Julia Dennebaum
    Theme Song: "The Distance" by Cake

    Online Exclusive!
    Believe it or not, the CREAMation Rules stipulation was planned way back in mid-summer without any captains even scheduled. But in August, Julia Dennebaum discussed the possibility of becoming team general with current boyfriend Ryan Rafferty. They immediately agreed on the then-originally planned attraction pitting both she and Ryan against Ashley Hoppe and a reluctant Michael Edwards.

    Around the time of ECD's "5 Year Anniversary" extravaganza, another couple was added to the mix in veterans Michelle Mullins and Dan Spengeman. With three boyfriend-girlfriend pairs willing and able to compete - none ever partaking in a CREAMation bout - each were split into the two formidable factions seen at "Divorce Court."

    It should also be noted that a possible fourth duo - Mari Travassos and Jon Yochum - were also asked to participate. Mari's work schedule however conflicted with her definite participation.

    ___________________________________________________________

    Next Event: WALL faces ALL for the first time in nearly 24 months on November 27. (Date subject to change)
